title: A Curious and diverse flora. Parts 1-5
creator_contributor_role: Australian Academy of Science, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Adaptation
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Botany - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Rain forests - Australia
abstract: Botany Bay (11 mins)--An isolated but related flora (9 mins)--A hard-leaved vegetation (10 mins)--Change and survival (15 mins)--Distant connections (13 mins)
description: Australian flora is shown as first discovered by Europeans in Botany Bay. Other Australian flora is shown from the isolated area of South Western Australia and from Tasmania. The distinctive flora of eucalypt forests and tropical rainforests is also shown. The program is in five parts. Written and presented by Dr. Peter Valder. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
